quest.name: One Way to Do It
journal: Anogg would like to continue what may be charitably termed the discussion at hand.

Anogg insists that it is in the village's best interest that you use the key to claim the androids' enigmatic weaponry as soon as possible so that the twins may study it. Forced to concede that she may have a point, Konogg agrees to help─though not without complaint. It seems you will be searching for that power source after all.

According to Anogg, one of the crystals that comprises a knocker should provide enough energy to power the key. She sends you off to the Dwarven Hollows to seek one out while she and Konogg consider the problem of how said energy might be harnessed for your purposes.
You pounce upon an unsuspecting knocker and bash it to pieces─all for the greater good, of course. Now with a sizable chunk of crystal in hand, you are ready to return to Anogg.

Though you provide the crystal to Anogg, successful implementation will require an amount of experimentation. The twins are keen to begin, but unfortunately for them, they are interrupted before they can so much as connect a whatsit to a thingamabob by the dig site chief, who will brook no further delay in the completion of their preparations for the upcoming carnival. As they grudgingly leave their work in the tunnels behind, he encourages you to attend the event. What exactly it entails remains a mystery, but one thing is certain: there will be drinking.
objectives: Deliver the chunk of knocker to Anogg.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: What were we talking about?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Ah, yes─why I'm right.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: I agree that we still know too little about the machine lifeforms and androids. But that's precisely why we need to seize this opportunity!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: If we claim the weaponry for ourselves, we'll know exactly what the enemy's capabilities are. Then─and only then─can we protect the village from comparable technology.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: Fine, fine. I see your point. We'll be safer in the long run if we activate the weaponry sooner rather than later. Or everyone else will─I'll probably have dropped dead from trying to keep up with you.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Hahaha! You say that, but you're far too stubborn to die. That's why I can always count on you!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: You too, most loyal and lethal assistant! Come along─we have a power source to find.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: I'm never sure if Anogg has the better argument, or if she's just better at arguing. I guess it doesn't matter─she usually gets what she wants in the end.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: It's about time!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: I've been considering what we need in order to power the key─a hefty chunk of crystal from a knocker ought to do it, though I haven't quite worked out how we'll divert its energy for our purposes.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Konogg and I will think on it while you head over to the hollows and liberate that crystal. Find us when you're back in Komra.

dialogue.name: KONOGG
dialogue.text: And another thing─why does Anogg's way always have to be so fun...

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Aha! You got one, right?

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Perfect. Now we can run some tests.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Yes, yes─it'll take a bit of experimentation to get the key powered up. It is science, you know.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Don't you worry, though─we'll have this thing in working order before you know it. While you wait, why not take some time for yourself? Have a nap, try some of our local delicacies, tell the chief to go bugger himself...

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Anogg! Konogg!

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Ah, and here's Forename. I knew you had roped herhim into your schemes again.

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: They're good schemes! And anyway, you're the one who keeps sending herhim to check on us.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I wouldn't have to if you'd do the work you were assigned. The carnival won't wait on your pet projects!

dialogue.name: ANOGG
dialogue.text: Fine, fine! Come on, Konogg. Let's get this over with.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: Frustrating as they are, you have to admire their enthusiasm for tinkering. If they can put even a tenth of that energy toward the carnival, we'll be ready in no time.

dialogue.name: DWARFMASTER03671
dialogue.text: I hope you'll be able to attend. You won't have seen the like before, I assure you. Not to mention that we're eager to show our appreciation for your helping us with those machines─and there's no better way to do that than with a dwarven toast to your health or two. Dozen.
